title: I report anyone who uses the referrence "gg ez", be it either ally or enemy
body:
I just hate seeing these words in any games I played. Today, the enemy ADC afked just because we killed her once, so it's a complete 5v4. After we finished the game, one of my teammates, Jax,  proceeded to constantly chat "gg ez" like about 2 to 3 times, once in-game & other after-match lobby. After I reported the enemy Jinx for AFK, I rushed to report our Jax for Unsportsmanlike Conduct.

#How could you let some simple 4 letter words affect you lol

Well, if you were the one saying those words, then I guess me reporting you & caused you to take a temporary suspension/permaban shouldn't affect you as well.

-----------

EDIT: To all the commenters who thinks that it's our fault, and that we should man up, or ignore the fact that it's just 4 letters through an online chat, and thus should not be reportable at all. Welp, **you're wrong.** 

I went to reconfirm with Riot Support, and got this:

http://i.imgur.com/JGQQwHs.png?1

Even Riot also approves it's a reportable fact.

So I don't care if you're trying to be Mr. Muscle Man or whatever, **that's your own thing.** If you're so macho, then I guess you have the courage enough to receive a suspension/banned/chat restriction for yourself. Do note that you're still playing on Riot's rules.

I don't let it get to me. In the event that it does get to me, I realize I need to take a cooldown, because something else is getting me riled up, to make something as minor as "gg ez" be *over the top* for me. 
I take a cooldown of 10-20+ minutes, or sometimes I will get offline for a bit and go do something else relaxing. If I feel relaxed and excited to play again after the cooldown, then I get in another game. 
If I am still thinking about it at the back of my mind, I will do something else until I forget about it.

It has nothing to do with "the toughest thing life has thrown at them". You can't justify being rude for no reason to someone just because some things are worse. I can't punch someone in the face because "well, you have a terminal disease, so this must mean nothing to you" [This is an intended exageration, before someone get triggered].

What's your reason to say "easy" at the end of the game aside from offending someone? Does it makes you feel better to attack someone for no reason? If it does, then it says nothing good about you.

tl;dr: "gg ez" is a little stupid thing, but that does not justify it.

Sportsmanship has nothing to do with the actual behavior of sportsmen; instead it refers to the ethical standards that they are expected to reach. Just because one word derives from the other one it does not force its meaning.

I answered your question. A one-time offense isn't harassment (though you are singling out a group by race, which counts as singling someone out) but it is hate speech which is also an offense, but a different one. If you continued it, then it would be both hate speech and harassment. Murder isn't considered stealing, but it's another crime. But if you robbed someone and killed them, it would be both murder and stealing.

Also getting up to someone and punching them in the face is physical abuse but not harassment. Yet another different category of offense.
